newsitem.title: INDIA: India gold, silver prices rise on world trends.
newsitem.headline: India gold, silver prices rise on world trends.

text.p: Indian gold and silver prices on Tuesday regained the initiative after easing slightly in early trade, dealers said.
"Increased speculative buying on reports of a rise in the world market sent up prices," one dealer said. On Monday, gold fell by 30 rupees per 10 grammes. Silver fell by 10 rupees per kg.
"Limited arrivals also helped prices to bounce back," the dealer said.
"Imported metal inflows are low and may remain like this as their costs have risen on world market trends," a broker said.
Prices of a gold biscuit (116.50 grammes) rose by 200 rupees to 57,600 rupees in early deals on Tuesday, against a fall of 300 rupees on Monday.
Overall sentiment was firm with traders expecting prices to forge ahead later in the day.
